assessment_steps.extracted_info: LRRK2 mutations (including R1441G) cause Parkinson's disease through impaired phosphorylation at S935 and disrupted 14-3-3 binding.
Affinity purification and mass spectrometry methods are used to assess phosphorylation and protein interactions, directly relevant to the mechanism.

assessment_steps.step: 3a. Evaluate validity of specific assays (basic controls)
assessment_steps.extracted_info: No explicit mention of wild-type or null controls in the abstract; findings are based on comparative analysis of mutant vs. wild-type LRRK2.
Affinity purification and mass spectrometry are standard techniques in the field for studying phosphorylation and protein interactions.
No statistical OddsPath values reported; the study relies on qualitative observations of impaired 14-3-3 binding and reduced phosphorylation.

LRRK2 mutations (including G2019S) cause Parkinson's disease through impaired phosphorylation at S935 and disrupted 14-3-3 binding.
Affinity purification and mass spectrometry methods are used to assess phosphorylation and protein interactions, directly relevant to the mechanism.

assessment_steps.step: 3a. Evaluate validity of specific assays (basic controls)
assessment_steps.extracted_info: No explicit mention of wild-type or null controls in the abstract; findings are based on comparative analysis of mutant vs. wild-type LRRK2.
Affinity purification and mass spectrometry are standard techniques in the field for studying phosphorylation and protein interactions.
No statistical OddsPath values reported; the study relies on qualitative observations of impaired 14-3-3 binding and reduced phosphorylation.

overall_conclusion: The three LRRK2 mutations (R1441G, Y1699C, G2019S) are associated with impaired 14-3-3 binding and reduced phosphorylation at S935, consistent with a pathogenic mechanism. However, the evidence strength is 'PS3_supporting' due to the absence of explicit controls, statistical OddsPath calculations, and limited variant control data in the abstract.
